g.text: • is registered at the AS as a confidential client and has a client secret
• client has a valid Refresh Token issued by the AS
a) issues opaque Refresh Token and Access Token using high entropy nonce data strings
b) maps the corresponding client secret to the issued tokens and stores the token data in a database
• generates the Route-JWT with a payload including the Refresh Token, issuer and a timestamp
Client sends the destination Route-JWT in the Authorization header
to authenticate itself to the AS token endpoint
a) looks up the Refresh Token data using the token claim value from the Route-JWT, and checks the token state
b) reconstructs an Itinerary-JWT using the Route-JWT payload data, token data and the corresponding client secret
c) compares the Itinerary-JWT signature with the Route-JWT signature, they are equal,
the Refresh Token route and the Route-JWT have been verified,
the AS validates the ts (timestamp) claim value from the Route-JWT, if valid,
the AS may generate and return a new Refresh Token and a new Access Token
